page.title: 03River Adur
page.content: The A27 flyover was built in 1968. It is constantly in need of repair mainly due to damage caused by salting the roads in winter. The Boat House belongs to Lancing College, and the pupils use the river for sailing and canoeing. Near the Boat House the motor-boats are washing away the mud, so the river banks are being built up with chalk by the Water Authority. South of the A27 flyover is the Pony and Donkey Centre of about 9 acres, where about 20 of them can be hired for riding. A private developer owns the field and he is wanting to build a Supermarket. The local residents welcome the idea because there are no other similar facilities in the immediate area.
